section_layout_002.title: Placement on main elements on menu

section_save_button_full.title:
Most settings are not automatically saved when modified.
Press any of the "Save settings" buttons for the settings to take effect.

pref_overlay_key.description: Keyboard shortcut to open and close the menu

pref_use_a_custom_icon_for_applet.tooltip: Unchecking this allows the theme to set the icon

pref_custom_icon_for_applet.tooltip: Select an icon to show in the panel.

pref_custom_label_for_applet.tooltip: Enter custom text to show in the panel.

pref_open_menu_on_hover.description: Open the menu on mouse over
pref_open_menu_on_hover.tooltip: Enable opening the menu when the mouse enters the applet.

pref_menu_hover_delay.tooltip: Delay before the menu is opened on entering the applet.

pref_enable_autoscroll.tooltip: Choose whether or not to enable smooth auto-scrolling in the application list.

pref_use_alternate_vector_box.tooltip: With this option enabled, an alternate method to select categories will be used. This method can improve the performance of the menu and is extracted from the applet called Configurable Menu by lestcape.

pref_use_hover_feedback.tooltip: If enabled, and the user picture is shown, every time an application/favorite/place/recent file is hovered or selected with keyboard navigation, its icon will be displayed where the user picture is located.

pref_cat_select_on_hover.tooltip: If disabled, categories can be selected by clicking on them instead of just hovering.

pref_appinfo_display_method.description: Display method for information about applications:

pref_display_fav_box.tooltip: Choose whether or not to show the left pane of the menu.

pref_show_places.tooltip: Choose whether or not to show bookmarks and places in the menu.

pref_show_recents_button.tooltip: For people who want the "Recent documents" category hidden without disabling recent documents globally.

pref_remember_recently_used_apps.tooltip:
From the moment this option is enabled, every application launched from the menu will be stored and displayed in the "Recent Applications" category.
Every time this option is disabled, the list of recently used applications will be cleared.

pref_swap_categories_box.tooltip: By default, the categories box is to the left of the applications list. With this option enabled, the categories box will be placed to the right of the applications list.

pref_apps_info_box_alignment_to_the_left.description: Align application info box text to the left

pref_user_picture_placement.tooltip: This option allows to display the user picture on the menu. Clicking on the picture will open "Account details". For the image to be shown, the applications info box also has to be displayed.

pref_lock_button_custom_icon.tooltip:
Only valid if the System buttons box is placed next to the Custom launchers box.
Leave blank to use default.

pref_logout_button_custom_icon.tooltip:
Only valid if the System buttons box is placed next to the Custom launchers box.
Leave blank to use default.

pref_shutdown_button_custom_icon.tooltip:
Only valid if the System buttons box is placed next to the Custom launchers box.
Leave blank to use default.

pref_search_filesystem.description: Enable file system path entry in search box
pref_search_filesystem.tooltip: Allows path entry in the menu search box.

pref_search_type.tooltip:
Choose the type of search you want the menu to perform.

Default: This is the same search used by the default Cinnamon menu applet. It searches for the application name, keywords, description and id. In 99% of cases, this type of search gives totally annoying, useless and unproductive results.

Fuzzy: This option enables an infinitely better sorting of search results. It's marked as experimental because it has a huge impact on performance every time the search box is cleared.

App name only: This type of search is similar to the default one, but it will only display results that matches the application name and nothing else.

pref_show_bumblebee_on_context.description: Show "Run with NVIDIA GPU" on context

pref_show_run_from_terminal_as_root_on_c.description: Show "Run from terminal as root" on context

pref_show_edit_desktop_file_on_context.tooltip: It adds to the applications context menu an entry that will allow you to open the current selected application's .desktop file in a text editor.

pref_gain_privileges_on_context.description: Gain privileges of not owned files
pref_gain_privileges_on_context.tooltip:
If enabled, this options will open as root .desktop files that aren't owned by the current user.

This isn't needed for all text editors. Some text editors will allow you to open and edit not owned files and will ask for the root password at the moment of saving the changes.

pref_custom_editor_for_edit_desktop_file.tooltip:
Set a custom text editor to open .desktop files (just the name of the text editor executable or the path to it).
Leave it blank to let the system decide.

pref_privilege_elevator.tooltip:
The graphical front-end to use to run applications as root.
This is used by the "Open as Root" context menu and the option "Gain privileges of not owned files".

pref_terminal_emulator.tooltip:
Choose the terminal emulator used by all launch from terminal options.
IMPORTANT!!! The terminal emulator has to support the -e argument.

pref_recent_apps_ignore_favorites.tooltip: If enabled, applications set as Favorite will not be stored in the "Recent Applications" category.

pref_recently_used_apps_separator.tooltip:
This option, when enabled, will break the menu keyboard navigation. Only enable this option if you will never use the keyboard to navigate the menu.
This message is only temporary until I figure out how to fix this.

pref_recently_used_apps_invert_order.tooltip: By default, the most recently used application is at the top of the list. With this option enabled, the most recently used application will be at the bottom of the list.

pref_recently_used_apps_custom_icon.tooltip:
Enter custom icon for the "Recent Applications" category.
Only icon names are allowed.

custom_launchers_label.description:
Fields marked with asterisks (*) are mandatory. Otherwise, the button will not appear on the menu.
Icons can be any icon name or path to an icon file (symbolic or full color).
Commands can be any command (as entered in a terminal) or a path to a file.
If the file is an executable script, an attempt to execute it will be made.
Otherwise, the file will be opened with the systems handler for that file type.

pref_display_category_icons.tooltip: Choose whether or not to show icons on categories.

pref_display_application_icons.tooltip: Choose whether or not to show icons on applications.

pref_info_box_title_font_size.description: Applications info box title font size:

pref_info_box_description_font_size.description: Applications info box description font size:

pref_user_picture_stylized.tooltip: With this option enabled, the box containing the user picture will have the same style as the Favorites box.

pref_autofit_searchbox_width.description: Auto-fit the width of the search box with the menu width
pref_autofit_searchbox_width.tooltip: If enabled, Custom width for search box will be ignored. Also, this option is ignored if the custom launchers box is placed at either side of the searchbox.

pref_custom_width_for_searchbox.tooltip: Set to 0 (zero) for not setting a width.

pref_separator_heigth.tooltip: Size of separator between "Favorites" box and "Quit" box.

pref_max_width_for_buttons.tooltip: Define the maximum width of menu items inside the applications box.

custom_padding_label.description:
Note: Most themes stylesheets come with hardcoded sizes for certain elemets.
This section is for overriding those stylesheets.

pref_set_categories_padding.description: Set a custom padding for the Categories box

pref_set_search_entry_padding.description: Set a custom padding for the search entry box

pref_set_search_box_padding.description: Set a custom padding for the search box

pref_set_custom_box_padding.description: Set a custom padding for the Custom launchers box

pref_set_info_box_padding.description: Set a custom padding for the Applications info box
